result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M. Lehman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paul M. Lehman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Paul M. Lehman was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 45 days.  PD James Ermert.
May not have contact with victim w/o court's permission.
Review hrg on 7/24/15 @ 9am. P&P to provide written report by 7/21/15.  Not to reside w/ anyone of the opposite sex w/o Court's permission.

records.addlTxt: 6yrs WSP; initial confinement of 3yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Catherine Lambrechts.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft sentenced to 6yrs WSP; initial confinement of 3yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Credit of 340 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.
revoc summary
Email received from Agent Erin Angel - DOC preceeding with revocation of deft's probation
Email received from Agent Erin Angel - deft was picked up due to absconding from probation.  Agent notified if DOC does not revoke probation - court should be notified so a RH can be scheduled

re: letter from Agent Erin Angel (7/16/15) - court shall be notified when deft is picked up; deft shall be held as a condition of probation pending a court hrg.  Email sent to Agent Erin Angel with a copy to defense counsel
from Agent Erin Angel - negative report re: deft; DOC has active warrant
Letter and attachments from Kingdom Keys for Righteous Living Ministry
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty James Ermert.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3 yrs.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Deft sentenced to 100 days KCJ as a condition of probation in addition to the 165 he has already served.  Huber allowed.  NOTE - remaining counts were dismissed per plea agreement

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty James Ermert.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 1/23/15 @ 9am.

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA A Burgoyne

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty James Ermert.  Brief discussion held on deft's wish to have Atty Ermert w/draw as counsel.  Court takes a short recess to allow the deft to Atty Ermert to confer.  Court reconvenes.  Atty Ermert reports the deft is w/drawing his request for a change of counsel.  Atty Ermert reports the deft relayed add'l information to him today.  JS to remain on for 12/1/14 @ 9am.  Parties to notify the court by noon on 11/25/14 if the case settles; no plea bargaining will be allowed thereafter.
from DE

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Ermert.  Defense requests an adjournment; offer has been relayed but Atty Ermert has not had time to go over the offer w/his client for the reasons set forth on the record.  FPT adj to 11/12/14 @ 10am
Scheduling Order

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty James Ermert.  Deft acknowledges receipt of the info.  Waive the reading.  Plea of not guilty entered to all counts.  FPT 10/22/14 @ 10:10am, JT 12/1/14 @ 9am.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. James Ermert. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3 for arraignment on 9-8-14 @ 1:30pm. Information filed. Bond continued.

to Preliminary Hearing
